title: What You Really Really Want The Smart Girl's Shame-Free Guide to
description:
In this empowering, accessible guide, Jaclyn FriedmanÃ¢â‚¬â€co-editor of Yes Means YesÃ¢â‚¬â€gives young women the tools to decipher the modern worldÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s confusing, hypersexualized, sometimes dangerous landscape so they can define their own sexual identity. Friedman decries the hypocrisy and mixed messages of our culture (weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re failures if we donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t act sexy, but weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re sluts if we actually pursue sex; we need to be protected from rapists lurking in bushes, but deserve Ã¢â‚¬Å“whatever we getÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ if we have a drink at a party and wear a skirt), and encourages readers to separate fear from fact, decode the damaging messages all around them, and discover a healthy personal sexuality.
Educational and interactive, What You Really Really Want includes revealing quizzes, creative exercises, and reality-based advice about sex and sexuality today. With FriedmanÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s informed advice to guide them, readers will build new skills for safely expressing their sexuality with lovers and explore effective ways to talk about tricky issues with family and friendsÃ¢â‚¬â€and learn how to make the world a little safer for everyone elseÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s sexuality along the way.
Genre: Non Fiction, Relationships, Sex
